StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: CIDR GWAS of Breast Cancer in High Risk Women

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Breast Cancer, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-BRCA-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Breast Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Breast and Ovarian cancer, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-BROC-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Breast and Ovarian cancer. Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, IRB, PUB, COL, NPU, MDS, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA-IRB-PUB-COL-NPU-MDS-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s). Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms). Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
The letter of collaboration for this study is the "POSH Access Request Form A" from the University of Southampton. A blank copy can be found at the end of the dataset's Data Use Certification Agreement (see dbGaP study page). Requestor must provide this signed form documenting POSH/University of Southampton approval. Please contact POSH Chief Investigator Prof. Diana Eccles to set up collaborative agreement (D.M.Eccles@soton.ac.uk).

ConsentGroup.title: Cancer, Benign Neoplasms, or Hematopoietic Diseases (MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: CABNHD-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use the data must related to cancer, benign neoplasms, or hematopoietic diseases related to cancer or risk of cancer. Benign neoplasms and hematopoietic diseases are understood as having potential for significant morbidity in themselves, such as benign brain tumors, neuroendocrine tumors, desmoid tumors, myelodysplastic syndromes, which are reportable or potentially reportable to cancer registries. This data may also be used for general methods research (e.g. development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Breast Diseases)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-BRD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Breast Diseases.
General methods development research is NOT allowed.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Breast Cancer, PUB, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-BRCA-PUB-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Breast Cancer. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (PUB)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-PUB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, PUB)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA-PUB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.
General methods development research is NOT permitted.
